CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Therefore , the DPP - based copolymers combined with fused heteroarenes have shown low band - gaps with excellent charge transport characteristics and thus a high short circuit current density ( J SC ) of the solar cell device.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DPP-based copolymers |
| fused heteroarenes |

Explanation:

* DPP-based copolymers: DPP refers to diketopyrrolopyrrole, which is a common unit in high-performance organic semiconductors. In this context, it refers to copolymers that contain DPP units.
* fused heteroarenes: Heteroarenes are aromatic compounds that contain at least one heteroatom (an atom that is not carbon) in their ring structure. Fused heteroarenes are multiple heteroarene units that are fused together. These materials have been used in organic electronics due to their excellent optoelectronic properties.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DPP-based copolymers |
| fused heteroarenes |

Explanation:

* DPP-based copolymers: DPP refers to diketopyrrolopyrrole, which is a common unit in high-performance organic semiconductors. In this context, it refers to copolymers that contain DPP units.
* fused heteroarenes: Heteroarenes are aromatic compounds that contain at least one heteroatom (an atom that is not carbon) in their ring structure. Fused heteroarenes are multiple heteroarene units that are fused together. These materials have been used in organic electronics due to their excellent optoelectronic properties.

The other entities mentioned in the paragraph, such as "low band-gaps", "excellent charge transport characteristics", "high short circuit current density (Jsc)", and "solar cell device" do not refer to material names, but rather to the properties and applications of the materials.
